trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Cheery Flavor
entries: This creature taste like cherry albeit a bit more acidic, biting in radical fashion will likely result in {@damage 1d4} acid damage to your throat

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the slime takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Body Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Suffocate
entries: The Slime try to wrap itself on enemy head to suffocate them, the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength or Dexterity saving throw or take  {@damage 1d6} Damage, per turn it stays there

A jelly like creature, some say it's weaker than a cat but don't be fooled, those shiny and bubbly body can stretch and bend like crazy making it hard to hit if it's aware of you, often called as Puni, Poring, or just slime

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) psychic damage.
Mind flayers unleash all manner of foul experiments upon the planes with little thought for the consequences. Here, though, I suspect another influence: Juiblex.

entries.name: Oblex Spawn
entries: An oblex devours memories not only to sustain its existence, but also to spawn new oblexes. Each time it fully drains the memories of a victim, it gains the creature's personality—now twisted by the oblex's foul nature. The more memories an oblex steals, the larger it becomes, until it must shed a personality it has absorbed or else go insane. This act spawns a new oblex.

entries.name: Oblex
entries: By experimenting on the slimes, jellies, and puddings that infest the depths of the Underdark, mind flayers created a special breed of ooze, the oblex—a slime capable of assaulting the minds of other creatures. Cunning hunters, these pools of jelly stalk prey, searching for the memories they so desperately crave. When oblexes feed on those thoughts, sometimes killing their victims, they can form weird copies of their prey, which help them to harvest even more victims for their dark masters.

entries.name: Memory Eaters
entries: Oblexes feed on thoughts and memories. The sharper the mind, the better the meal, so oblexes hunt obviously intelligent targets such as wizards and other spellcasters. When suitable fare comes within reach, an oblex draws its body up to engulf its victim. As it withdraws, it plunders the creature's mind, leaving its prey befuddled and confused.

entries.name: Ooze Nature
entries: An oblex doesn't require sleep.

An oblex wants memories, but not to serve any end of its own making. Oblexes are hungry for memories and personalities because they are empty without such nourishment. In this way they serve their creators, the illithids. An oblex in the range of an elder brain's powers provides everything necessary for the mind flayers to find choice victims.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Strong Acid
entries: his creature taste like nothing, when you bite to it, the sensation you feel is just burning akin to licking strong sulfuric acid, the aftertaste will leave your tongue numb, but it's smells like pinewood and grass, biting it, whether in radical or orderly fashion will always result in {@damage 1d8} acid damage to your throat and mouth, you might want to process it before consuming it

trait.name: Unstable Chemistry
entries: If the slime takes fire damage, it could explode maybe

action.name: Stationary Fire / Multiattack
entries: if the acid slime does not move, it could do acid spit twice

action.name: Body Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. + {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage

action.name: Acid Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) acid damage.

A jelly like creature, some say it's weaker than a cat but don't be fooled, those shiny and bubbly body can stretch and bend like crazy making it hard to hit if it's aware of you, often called as Puni, Poring, or just slime
